com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase

Class MecanumDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase.RobotDrive
      • com.arcrobotics.ftclib.drivebase.MecanumDrive

  • public class MecanumDrive
extends RobotDrive
    This is a classfile representing the kinematics of a mecanum drivetrain and controls their speed. The drive methods driveRobotCentric(double, double, double) and driveFieldCentric(double, double, double, double) are meant to be put inside of a loop. You can call them in void loop() in an OpMode and within a while (!isStopRequested() && opModeIsActive()) loop in the runOpMode() method in LinearOpMode. For the derivation of mecanum kinematics, please watch this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8rhAkjViHEQ.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MecanumDrive

        public MecanumDrive(Motor... myMotors)
        Sets up the constructor for the mecanum drive. Automatically inverts right side by default
        Parameters:
        myMotors - The motors in order of: frontLeft, frontRight, backLeft, backRight. Do not input in any other order.

      • MecanumDrive

        public MecanumDrive(boolean autoInvert,
                    Motor... myMotors)
        Sets up the constructor for the mecanum drive.
        Parameters:
        autoInvert - Whether or not to automatically invert the right motors
        myMotors - The motors in order of: frontLeft, frontRight, backLeft, backRight. Do not input in any other order.

    • Method Detail

      • isRightSideInverted

        public boolean isRightSideInverted()
        Checks if the right side motors are inverted.
        Returns:
        true if the multiplier for the right side is equal to -1.

      • setRightSideInverted

        public void setRightSideInverted(boolean isInverted)
        Sets the right side inversion factor to the specified boolean.
        Parameters:
        isInverted - If true, sets the right side multiplier to -1 or 1 if false.

      • driveRobotCentric

        public void driveRobotCentric(double xSpeed,
                              double ySpeed,
                              double turnSpeed)
        Drives the robot from the perspective of the robot itself rather than that of the driver.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - the horizontal speed of the robot, derived from input
        ySpeed - the vertical speed of the robot, derived from input
        turnSpeed - the turn speed of the robot, derived from input

      • driveRobotCentric

        public void driveRobotCentric(double xSpeed,
                              double ySpeed,
                              double turnSpeed,
                              boolean squareInputs)
        Drives the robot from the perspective of the driver. No matter the orientation of the robot, pushing forward on the drive stick will always drive the robot away from the driver.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - the horizontal speed of the robot, derived from input
        ySpeed - the vertical speed of the robot, derived from input
        turnSpeed - the turn speed of the robot, derived from input
        squareInputs - Square the value of the input to allow for finer control

      • driveFieldCentric

        public void driveFieldCentric(double xSpeed,
                              double ySpeed,
                              double turnSpeed,
                              double gyroAngle)
        Drives the robot from the perspective of the driver. No matter the orientation of the robot, pushing forward on the drive stick will always drive the robot away from the driver.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - the horizontal speed of the robot, derived from input
        ySpeed - the vertical speed of the robot, derived from input
        turnSpeed - the turn speed of the robot, derived from input
        gyroAngle - the heading of the robot, derived from the gyro

      • driveFieldCentric

        public void driveFieldCentric(double xSpeed,
                              double ySpeed,
                              double turnSpeed,
                              double gyroAngle,
                              boolean squareInputs)
        Drives the robot from the perspective of the driver. No matter the orientation of the robot, pushing forward on the drive stick will always drive the robot away from the driver.
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - the horizontal speed of the robot, derived from input
        ySpeed - the vertical speed of the robot, derived from input
        turnSpeed - the turn speed of the robot, derived from input
        gyroAngle - the heading of the robot, derived from the gyro
        squareInputs - Square the value of the input to allow for finer control
